page.title: 13Amenities Committee-Ufton
page.content: Since it began in 1975 the village amenities committee has raised the following amounts (in pounds) for local needs. 100 was donated for the bus shelter, 20 for the village hall, 20 for the jubilee fund, 99 for a wheelchair, 20 for entertaining Russian visitors, 180 for chairs for the village,30 for Victorian clothes when the school closed,55 for trees in Reeds Park,98 for a church lawnmower,300 for the church,30 to the WARNACT for Christmas trees,20 for the Mothers Union kneelers 70 for the church Fabric Fund,10 for the playgroup Christmas party,241 for street lights,268 for the Warwickshire Association for the Blind & 50 for the strimmer for the churchyard.The total on the 6th of July 1985 was 1765.
